titleStmt.title: Prelatique preachers none of Christ's teachers, or, A Disswasive unto the people of God from attending the ministry (so called) of those, who preach by verture of an (Apocryphal) ordination, received from an order of men, commonly stiled Lord Bishops wherein arguments are tendered to their serious considerations, by way of motive against that practice ... .

Prelatique preachers none of Christ's teachers, or, A Disswasive unto the people of God from attending the ministry (so called) of those, who preach by verture of an (Apocryphal) ordination, received from an order of men, commonly stiled Lord Bishops wherein arguments are tendered to their serious considerations, by way of motive against that practice ... .
titleStmt.author: Goodwin, John, 1594?-1665.

notesStmt.note: "Ascription to John Goodwin very doubtful"--NUC pre-1956 imprints.
Imperfect: pages stained with loss of print.
Reproduction of original in the Huntington Library.
